summary: I am a practical strategist, leadership coach, author, and professor working at the intersection of faith and real-world impact. Drawing from experience as a business executive, pastor, educator, and a leading voice in the U.S. faith and work movement, I am passionate to see people fully activated and engaged in their callings, to accelerate and facilitate transformation of leaders and organizations, and for the local church to be equipped to lead people into a biblical understanding of faith, work, and economic wisdom. I was an Area Vice-President with AT&T by age 30, then served as a pastor under Pastor Rick Warren at Saddleback Church where I was the architect and visionary of Saddleback@Work, the workplace ministry. Currently, I am an ICF certified leadership and strategy coach, a professor of ethics, leadership, and strategy at The Crowell School of Business at Biola University, and the Director of the Talbot Center for Faith, Work & Economics where I empower believers to work from biblical principles in all areas of their lives and work with pastors to build organizational competency in the local church to effectively disciple people in their work life. I hold master's degrees in both leadership and theology from Biola University and have studied in the Executive Program at Columbia University. Specialties include: ‚Ä¢ Executive coaching ‚Ä¢ Leadership development ‚Ä¢ Strategic and operational alignment ‚Ä¢ Ethics ‚Ä¢ Organizational change and cultural transformation ‚Ä¢ Employee engagement ‚Ä¢ Theology of work ‚Ä¢ Walking out the calling in the marketplace ‚Ä¢ Women‚Äôs leadership and influence ‚Ä¢ Faith-work integration in the local church ‚Ä¢ Research on sustainable worklife ministry models for impact ‚Ä¢ Developing and maintaining workplace small groups
job title: Faculty - Leadership, Ethics, and Strategic Management Professor

linkedin description: Welcome to the Crowell School of Business where we provide a distinctive approach to business leadership. We call it Business as Ministry. Why is this important? Because business touches every area of contemporary life from the latest products to essential services, and we can‚Äôt live without the benefits today‚Äôs companies provide. But we regularly read about corporations or even whole industries that seem to stumble from one ethics-related crisis to another. We see failures of leadership at once-trusted brands that cast doubt on pursuing business as a career. Can business be conducted in a way that benefits society, builds profitable and sustainable companies, and is consistent with Christian faith? At the Crowell School of Business our faculty believes that business may be one of the most impactful career choices available for lives of service today. Whether in a public or private company, for profit or non-profit, known brand or entrepreneurial start up, the knowledge and skills you gain at the Crowell School will be valuable for a lifetime of impact. Why are we uniquely positioned to provide this distinctive approach to business leadership? Because the Crowell School faculty along with the other five schools at Biola University take the integration of faith and knowledge seriously as it applies to business, theology, the arts and sciences, humanities and more. Few business schools work so intentionally to pull from various academic and spiritual disciplines to equip students for lives of significance and impact. At Crowell, business education is designed so you learn and put into practice career-relevant business skills while engaging your faith and launching your career. We invite you to learn more about our School and programs by following us on LinkedIn and going to our web page. Or even better: come by and visit us some time!
job description (2): Faculty member delivering high level professional coach training to emerging coaches in the School of Leadership.
linkedin description (2): Welcome to the life and leadership coach training school that is distinctly Christian as well as ICF aligned; the gold standard of the coaching profession! Our virtual training school is based in the U.S. and Canada but we have graduates from nearly 40 countries throughout Europe, Asia, Australia, Central & South America, the Middle East, and Africa. Our high-definition telebridges are state-of-the-art, enabling you to train by phone on any standard land line, cell phone, or VOIP service (such as Skype). Founder, Chris McCluskey, is a founding board member of the Christian Coaches Network, the first professional association for Christian coaches. Our faith integration is unmistakingably Christian while remaining non-denominational and highly ecumenical. All of our faculty are Christian coaches certified through the International Coach Federation (ICF) who operate successful coaching businesses of their own. They have trained nearly 4,000 persons world-wide and taught Christian coaching through various programs since 1999. Our students come from all walks of life, including business leaders & professionals, counselors/therapists, pastors & missionaries, nurses, stay-at-home moms and more. All of our core courses are approved by the International Coach Federation (ICF) as Approved Coach-Specific Training Hours (ACSTH). PCCI offers business development & marketing classes to get you earning a solid income ‚Äì QUICKLY!! Our highly-acclaimed course, The Successful Coach, has been privately contracted by entire denominations and teams of coaches because of its strength in launching successful coaching practices. PCCI provides a wide range of advanced specialty classes, enabling you to brand & niche yourself in the marketplace. PCCI encourages networking so that no one feels alone on their coaching journey; we're a family! We'd love to have you join us! Learn more here: https://professionalchristiancoaching.com

summary: Darryl A. Simon is Global Managing Partner & Founder of Vantage Growth Strategic Advisors. He is a versatile and accomplished global leadership development strategist and executive coach, a trusted diversity, equity, and inclusion strategist, a proven organizational change advisor, trusted C-Suite and Board advisor and former senior corporate executive. He is valued by his clients for his thought-provoking questions, keen listening skills, powers of observation and analysis, strategic insights, and his thoughtful guidance and advice in working with leaders, teams, and organizations. With 35 years of senior-level experience, Darryl has effectively collaborated with and advised senior leaders and Boards of more than 100 diverse global private, public, and non-profit organizations. As an executive coach, Darryl has worked with more than 300 executives and teams from diverse functions and industries and helped them increase their self-awareness, self-mastery, power, and influence in effectively leading change, increasing their strategic effectiveness, team performance and business results for their organizations. Darryl is also a thought leader in the advising, mentoring, assessment, coaching and development of racially and ethnically diverse, under-represented leaders and organizations. Having worked with several professional and industry associations over the past 20 years, he most recently served on the faculty of the Executive Leadership Council‚Äôs Institute for Leadership Development & Research. At the Institute, he developed and facilitated successful programs for 600+ black leaders and executives of leading Fortune 500 companies. Darryl‚Äôs diverse clients include BET Networks, Boston Scientific Corp., Bunge International, CBS Television Studios, Choice Hotels International, Clorox, Comcast/NBC Universal, Constellation Energy, Dimension Data, DuPont, Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac, Global Fund, Habitat for Humanity, HBO, International Monetary Fund, Invesco, Johns Hopkins Applied Physics Lab, KPMG, MedStar Health, National Football League, Northrop Grumman, One Main Financial, Paramount, Sallie Mae, Time Warner, Verizon, and Yale New Haven Health. Prior to Vantage Growth, Darryl held C-Suite human resources executive positions for Fortune 500 & 1000 healthcare, energy, and commercial real estate companies, along with similar senior executive and advisory roles in technology and international development firms. In these roles, he advised C-Suite leaders and Boards, and successfully implemented leadership and organizational development strategies.
job description: Darryl is Global Managing Partner & Founder of Vantage Growth Strategic Advisors, a global advisory consortium specializing in strategic planning, leadership and organizational development, program design and facilitation, diversity, equity and inclusion, change management for leading U.S. and global Fortune 1000, not-for-profit and public clients. summary: Do you ever feel like walking into work is like walking into an ambush? Too many projects and unclear priorities. Poor teamwork and collaboration. Leading a manufacturing team is hard. But it doesn‚Äôt have to be this hard. At The Effective Syndicate, we don‚Äôt just fix one problem‚Äîwe fill every gap. We‚Äôve spent over 24 years helping leaders across the country implement bullet-proof processes, save millions, and build high-performing teams that can execute with confidence‚Äîeven when the boss isn‚Äôt watching. That‚Äôs why we created the GSD System. (Yes, it stands for Get Stuff Done.) Because real solutions don‚Äôt come from flavor-of-the-month programs. They come from systematizing your leadership and your processes so your operation runs with clarity, discipline, and energy. And we didn‚Äôt stop there. We built a family of brands designed to support every aspect of your manufacturing business: ‚úÖ The Effective Syndicate ‚Äì Lean Six Sigma consulting, leadership development, and operational improvement to drive real, sustainable growth. ‚úÖ TES Recruiting ‚Äì Finding top-tier manufacturing talent, from the shop floor to the C-suite. ‚úÖ Swiftemp ‚Äì Providing fast, reliable staffing solutions for temporary-to-hire roles in manufacturing and metal fabrication. ‚úÖ GSD Manager Training ‚Äì Equipping managers with practical, no-nonsense leadership training to boost accountability, productivity, and morale. We‚Äôre here to get you off the hamster wheel. Out of the ‚Äúwhack-a-mole‚Äù game. And into a place where your team knows how to win every day. If you‚Äôre ready to build a company that doesn‚Äôt just survive but thrives‚Äîwithout you needing to hold it together with duct tape and long hours‚Äîwe should talk. summary: My journey began with a simple belief - every question asked, every detail noted, and every recommendation made could be the difference between a good speaker or event and an extraordinary one. Today, I bring years of experience to speakers at every stage of their career. Whether you're just starting out, finding your voice, or already setting the stage, I've seen every aspect of event planning, and I'm here to guide speakers through it all. But here's what really matters: trust. It's the foundation of any successful coaching relationship. When you work with me, you're not just getting a coach; you're getting someone who genuinely cares about your success. Someone who will always have your best interests at heart. Because let's face it - this industry is all about people. It's about the connections we make, the stories we share, and the impact we leave behind.
job description (2): I am the founder of Goodman Speakers, Inc., formerly Goodman Speakers Bureau, Inc. located in Windsor, CT. I founded the company in 1979. Since its inception, Goodman Speakers has enjoyed an impeccable reputation for trust and integrity and is well known among meeting planners throughout the world. ‚Ä¢ In June of 2008, Goodman Speakers Bureau was certified as a Woman Business Enterprise (WBE) through the Center for Women & Enterprise (CWE). ‚Ä¢ I have earned my professional designation as a CMP (Certified Meeting Planner) and am active member and volunteer for several associations in the meeting planning industry including Meeting Professionals International, and Financial and Insurance Conference Planners Association. ‚Ä¢ I am a founding member of the International Association of Speakers Bureaus, the association responsible for setting the ethics and standards in the bureau industry internationally. ‚Ä¢ I served on the board of directors for the Greater Hartford Convention and Visitors Bureau and on the Board of Corporate Advisors for Women Work!, a national organization that advocates women‚Äôs economic self-sufficiency. I am also a past president of the American Marketing Association, CT Chapter. ‚Ä¢ I was selected for membership in the exclusive 2006 Leadership America program series because of her successful roles as entrepreneur, leader, mentor, and active member of the community. Leadership America is the nation‚Äôs longest-running independent women‚Äôs leadership organization that recognizes, educates, and connects accomplished American women in business, government, education, and non-profit areas. ‚Ä¢ The Hartford Business Journal selected me as a 2009 ‚ÄúWomen in Business‚Äù award recipient. I am a mother of three grown children and enjoy the company of my family, including nine grandchildren. ‚Ä¢ Specialties: Consulting with clients; educating new meeting professionals about speakers and the value of the bureau.

summary: Anne Tammel, founder of OC CEO Collective and SoCal Women in Business, is a chief executive advisor and strategy consultant, guiding organizational leaders through cultural transformation, competitive positioning, and strategic growth. Redefining leadership, author of Poets and Dreamers: Thought Leaders and Visionaries and the forthcoming OC CEO Journal, Anne is a public speaker who leads transformative, high-engagement business experiences and CEO masterminds focused on leadership strategy, executive presence, and entrepreneurial mindset. Drawing on decades of experience across Silicon Valley, global corporations, and entrepreneurship, Anne brings clarity, structure, and human-centered strategy to organizations navigating growth and transition. Her advisory background includes executives from Google, YouTube, Microsoft, Citi, Bank of America, Merrill Lynch, EY, PwC, Deloitte, Neiman Marcus, Macy‚Äôs, IBM, Baxter, gold-medal Olympian athletes, global nonprofits, founders, and emerging ventures. Having begun her career at the Silicon Valley's leading PR firm, Cunningham Communication, architecting positioning strategy and brand communications frameworks for the most influential leaders in tech, Anne‚Äôs philosophy blends Silicon Valley strategy with the USC Marshall ethos of organizational excellence, emotional intelligence, and contemporary leadership design. Drawing from her work as founder of Poets and Dreamers LLC, where Anne developed a positive team culture model for high conflict organizations, Anne now curates and leads high-engagement executive leadership events, CEO roundtables, executive masterminds, leadership retreats, and programs that strengthen cultural identity, elevate executive presence, and unlock collaborative performance. With a Master of Executive Leadership from USC, an MFA in Creative Writing, and as an MBA candidate from USC Marshall, Anne is an ICF Professional Certified Coach (PCC), an ICF Advanced Certified Team Coach (ACTC), who integrates systems thinking, emotional intelligence, and neuroscience. Recognized by CBS Los Angeles for leading community transformation, Anne leads a regional movement focused on redefining leadership, uniting and elevating women in business, and shaping organizational identity. - Strategic Planning, Growth + CEO Advisory - Leadership Development Programs + Summits - Communications, Positioning + Thought Leadership - Culture Transformation + Organizational Identity - Executive Coaching + Leadership Strategy - Team Coaching; Collective Performance - Emotional Intelligence; Resilience Development

summary: You know how hard it is to buy fresh food at reasonable prices year-round that hasn‚Äôt travelled thousands of miles and arrived at the grocery store still ‚Äúgreen‚Äù? Nearly 19 million people in the US live in ‚Äúfood deserts‚Äù, meaning they don‚Äôt live near a grocery store. It‚Äôs not just lower-income folks that struggle. Big cities like LA and NY and Chicago have trouble providing fresh food to its citizens. I work with architects, engineers, farmers, and city planners to create buildings that come alive and are a source of food for the people that live there. There tends to be a struggle between architects, engineers, and city planners to develop indoor farms that meet strict building codes, are architecturally attractive, and can grow the foods that people want to eat. Growing thousands of plants indoors with these building restrictions quickly complicate the project. The people that are involved in these projects have specialized knowledge, like a musician in a symphony. They are experts at their instrument and look to the Conductor to provide guidance on when and how to play so that the music is played beautifully for the audience. I‚Äôm like the conductor when it comes to these big projects. I can ‚Äúsee‚Äù how, when, and where, the players need to bring their specialized knowledge to create the building that grows the food desired by the audience (in this case, the people that live in the city). Conductors know when certain instrument need to play louder, softer, and not at all. As the conductor, I know when to engage the engineers, architects, farmers, city planners and funders. When people work with me, they know they are an integral part of the team and how their role fits into production. More important, they can focus on bringing their specialized skills and talents to the project, free from the stresses of micromanaging components that don‚Äôt excite them or detract from what they love working on. What kind of food sustainability projects are you trying to build? I'd love to listen and see how I can support your efforts.

summary: I provide job seekers coaching support, expertise, and guidance, including writing resumes, cover letters, and LinkedIn profiles. summary: For over 40 years, entrepreneur, best-selling author, business coach and organizational consultant, Monika K. Moss-Gransberry (www.monikakmoss.com) has dedicated her talents to transforming organizations and building the capacity of individuals in them. A certified Gestalt Organizational Systems Development Practitioner, Monika currently serves on the faculty of the Gestalt Organizational Systems Development Center which trains leaders around the world in organizational effectiveness and self-mastery. summary: Driven by purpose and resilience, I‚Äôve transformed my lived experience with incarceration and growing up in an underserved Salt Lake City neighborhood into a mission: driving change across communities, organizations, and the justice system. linkedin description (4): Businesses often struggle to get to the next level. Staff do their best to execute on the organizational mission and vision, but do so in silos, with their processes disconnected from one another, stuck in one person's head. As a result, customer experience can be hit-or-miss, balls get dropped between departmental handoffs, spreadsheets shuffle, and companies stall in growth. As organizations grow, the processes and practices that served them until now won't serve them in the future. Adding new layers of leadership and management requires upgrades to the way companies communicate and collaborate. With over 20 years experience helping organizations rapidly grow from 50 to 500+ employees, implement digital transformation initiatives, and build and document repeatable processes, Strategic Matter can help you identify the most important next steps in your strategy. Our process begins with a comprehensive assessment of your organization, incorporating your leadership team's perspectives on the current identity of the organization, deep analysis of the entire company's capacity for change, and a collaborative inventory of your operational maturity in over 47 facets of your business operations. From there, we customize an action plan prioritized to match your objectives and move your company forward with accountability and clarity. To gain momentum, we'll walk with you through implementation and ongoing management and improvement, revising the roadmap for your business as the horizon changes. Our extensive network of specialists can help fill any gaps - from HR, to marketing, to accounting and finance, to technology, we can help you build your team and go to your next level.

job description: When you are a Fortune 500 business unit leader, small business owner, or senior leader of a mid-sized organization, you deal with your share of leadership challenges. My clients know how much I care about building personal relationships and delivering the proper strategic insight at the right time. Caring deeply for my clients and providing a significant impact is the essence of my work. My experience comes from what I‚Äôve learned by overcoming my challenges and building an incredibly successful business, along with working with some of the most successful business leaders in America, Canada and Europe. summary: I‚Äôm Keith Liscio, the Founder and President of Excelsior Franchise Center. My background and experience have uniquely prepared me to serve as a consultant and coach to prospective business owners considering an investment in a franchise system. My mission is to work with clients to winnow thousands of franchises down to a handful of good options, and ultimately the perfect business for them. I grew up in a series of small, family-run businesses ‚Äì everything from a dry-cleaning shop to a liquor store to a meat market/deli/bakery. After getting a degree in marketing from Villanova University (and later an MBA from the Wharton School) I turned my attention to the corporate world working at Fortune 500 Companies like Procter & Gamble, Nabisco, and Kraft. Eventually, I became an entrepreneur importing ceramics from Italy and then spending almost 20 years running my own Executive Recruiting firm. I was even employed by a couple of franchisees along the way, flipping burgers at McDonald‚Äôs in college and working at one of the Midwest‚Äôs leading offices for Management Recruiters International. If I‚Äôve learned anything along this journey it‚Äôs that running a business is NOT for everybody. Entrepreneurship is even tougher, taking long hours, expertise, commitment, and a high tolerance for risk. That said, business ownership can be incredibly fulfilling and offers many benefits in terms of work/life balance, financial rewards, and tax advantages. Best of all, being your own boss can be great. Really great. For many people, buying a franchise business can be the best way to become a business owner. You‚Äôre investing in an established system that‚Äôs already successful. You‚Äôre in business for yourself, but not by yourself. There are hundreds of options available allowing buyers to choose a business that capitalizes on their strengths and interests while accommodating their preferred working styles. Best of all, I know the GOOD franchises, can save you time and money, and there is no charge for my service. All my fees are paid from the marketing budgets of my franchise partners. If you‚Äôre serious about being in business, I can find one that will fit your needs. If you‚Äôd like to learn more, schedule some time on my calendar and I‚Äôd be happy to answer any questions you might have. Just click here: https://meetings.hubspot.com/keith-liscio
job description: My company, Excelsior Franchise Center, has teamed with the Franchise Brokers Association to partner with over 800 of America's best franchise systems. summary: Most teams I work with don‚Äôt have a pipeline problem. They have a decision and conversion problem. Deals stall once they enter the organization. Champions lose momentum. Approvals slow. Revenue looks committed but never actually lands. Founders bring me in when that gap becomes visible and the business needs real revenue movement in the next 30 to 90 days, not another planning cycle. I operate as a Revenue Operating Partner. I work inside live deals, coaching founders and reps where decisions are breaking down, not periodically reviewing dashboards after the fact. Part founder advisor. Part deal strategist. Part GTM architect. How I help: ‚Ä¢ Diagnose where deals are truly failing: decision ownership, internal alignment, risk tolerance, or economic justification ‚Ä¢ Coach founders through commercial sequencing, trade-offs, and hard calls that teams avoid making‚Ä¢ Work directly inside active deals to equip champions with forwardable, CFO-ready business cases that survive executive scrutiny ‚Ä¢ Establish a simple operating rhythm that improves deal quality, speed, and predictability without adding process overhead Typical outcomes: ‚Ä¢ Six- and seven-figure opportunities reactivated after stalling‚Ä¢ Material reductions in deal cycle time once decision friction is addressed ‚Ä¢ Clear internal narratives that unlock approvals without escalation‚Ä¢ Founders regaining control of revenue conversations with boards and investors ‚Ä¢ Improved revenue execution preceding successful acquisitions I‚Äôm not a generic founder coach, and I‚Äôm not a fractional CRO. Those roles often diagnose problems after the window to act has passed. I specialize in one thing: Turning existing demand into closed revenue by fixing conversion at the point where decisions actually fail. If you‚Äôre carrying CEO and CRO responsibilities and deals are slowing inside the funnel, I help you make better revenue decisions and close what‚Äôs already on your desk.

summary: A while back, I found myself at a crossroads.I wanted my next role to check three key boxes:‚úî Work with a leader I respected (or better yet, was inspired by)‚úî Be part of a company whose mission excited me‚úî Fit into a culture where people actually thrive. What I really love‚Äîthe work that fires me up‚Äîis helping leaders and teams find their power and perform at their potential. Across my career, whether I was turning around a struggling nonprofit, helping to scale a cybersecurity firm, working on the Olympics, or running my own business, I kept seeing the same issue:‚û°Ô∏è Companies often put good people in leadership roles without the right training or support.‚û°Ô∏è Those leaders struggle, which leads to frustration, turnover, and wasted potential.‚û°Ô∏è The business suffers, and no one wins. But when companies get it right‚Äîwhen they develop strong leaders, put people in roles that fit their strengths, and create a culture where teams perform. Leadership isn‚Äôt about titles‚Äîit‚Äôs about unlocking potential. When you get that right, performance, retention, and engagement follow naturally. Curious where to start? summary: Most leaders face a common challenge: feeling stuck in patterns of disconnection, misalignment, or uncertainty ‚Äî especially during transitions like mergers, leadership changes, or rapid growth. job description: Elevating the Coaching Profession Across the United States As Founding President of EMCC USA, I lead the national affiliate of the EMCC, championing excellence, ethics, and systemic thinking in coaching, mentoring, supervision, and team development. job description (2): Who We Are: I founded the You Are a GIFT Foundation to help mothers overcome prescription drug addiction and restore wholeness in their lives. After experiencing the personal loss of my daughter, I gained a profound perspective on what truly matters in life. This realization inspired a mission to provide mothers with the education, support, and resources they need to overcome addiction and rebuild their relationships and purpose. The foundation‚Äôs name, ‚ÄúGIFT,‚Äù reflects our core mission: to help individuals Reflect God‚Äôs Image and Fulfill their Talent in service to others. By empowering mothers to heal and thrive, we aim to glorify God through purposeful living. How We Help: At the You Are a GIFT Foundation, we focus on partnering with local organizations and nonprofits to address the unique challenges mothers face on the journey to becoming addiction-free. Through strategic collaborations, we provide: - Access to education and rehabilitation programs. - Tailored solutions to overcome obstacles preventing recovery. - Awareness campaigns to promote addiction prevention and family restoration. Our work is centered on offering a pathway for mothers to rebuild their lives, strengthen their families, and reclaim their purpose. Why We Exist: Prescription drug addiction often leaves mothers struggling to navigate the path to recovery alone. Our foundation exists to fill this gap by partnering with organizations to provide critical support, foster awareness, and pilot funding initiatives. Our ultimate goal is to empower mothers to overcome addiction, rebuild relationships with their families, and live meaningful, purpose-driven lives.
linkedin description (2): Thousands of mothers in America are affected by prescription drug addiction. Our mission is to provide them with the education and assistance they need to restore wholeness. Our Mission: The You Are A GIFT Foundation is a regional non-profit based in Alabama that partners with organizations to help mothers overcome prescription drug addiction so they can live a meaningful life. Our Vision: To help mothers overcome prescription drug addiction. What We Do: At You Are A GIFT we collaborate with organizations that are equipped to identify the obstacles that prevent mothers from receiving rehabilitation. We exist to promote addiction prevention, drive awareness, and pilot funding; all with the goal of restoring relationships for mothers and their families.
linkedin specialities (2): Drug addiction, Addiction, Addiction prevention, Mothers and Families

linkedin description (4): The mission of the United States Air Force is to fly, fight and win ‚Ä¶ in air, space and cyberspace. To achieve that mission, the Air Force has a vision of Global Vigilance, Reach and Power. That vision orbits around three core competencies: developing Airmen, technology to war fighting and integrating operations. These core competencies make our six distinctive capabilities possible. Air and Space Superiority: With it, joint forces can dominate enemy operations in all dimensions: land, sea, air and space. Global Attack: Because of technological advances, the Air Force can attack anywhere, anytime and do so quickly and with greater precision than ever before. Rapid Global Mobility: Being able to respond quickly and decisively anywhere we're needed is key to maintaining rapid global mobility. Precision Engagement: The essence lies in the ability to apply selective force against specific targets because the nature and variety of future contingencies demand both precise and reliable use of military power with minimal risk and collateral damage. Information Superiority: The ability of joint force commanders to keep pace with information and incorporate it into a campaign plan is crucial. Agile Combat Support: Deployment and sustainment are keys to successful operations and cannot be separated. Agile combat support applies to all forces, from those permanently based to contingency buildups to expeditionary

summary: With over 25 years of experience across tech startups, creative agencies, and enterprise partnerships, I‚Äôve built, scaled, and advised businesses at every stage‚Äîfrom ideation to acquisition. My track record includes driving double-digit growth, turning chaos into systems, investing in 15 startups, and mentoring 20+ companies through TechStars. But here‚Äôs where it gets different: Through my own journey of entrepreneurship and mentorship, I realized that true, sustainable success doesn‚Äôt come from strategy alone ‚Äî it comes from self-awareness. Whether I‚Äôm consulting as a fractional CRO, helping a startup scale, or guiding an executive through a transition, I bring equal parts tactical precision and intuitive insight. job description: With 20+ years of experience helping founders and teams uncover blind spots and unlock potential, I‚Äôve learned that lasting transformation doesn‚Äôt begin with strategy ‚Äî it begins within. job description: Founded and lead a national organization that creates and maintains an ecosystem that helps schools and districts recruit, retain, and retire Black male teachers, by cultivating the skills of Black males as early as kindergarten, and coordinating institutional pathways for them to matriculate to and through the profession.
linkedin description: Black male teachers have shown to have the greatest impact on student achievement. But, they make up only 1.3% of the profession. To shift this, we need an earlier start and longer support. We see today‚Äôs Black male students as tomorrow‚Äôs Black male teachers. Our goal is for young Black males to discover teaching, then support them at every point on their path to and through the profession. We do this through direct programming and key partnerships. This is The Black Male Teacher Initiative. PreK- High School: In our I AM KING Program (IAK), we train and mentor Black male high school students to deliver social-emotional learning content to younger boys of color. College: Black male college students join our Fellowship in the summer, where they receive instructional support to teach middle school students. Fellows engage in Black male affinity groups during their experience. In the following school year, they have access to additional professional development and networking opportunities, including taking our Introduction to Education, Equity, and Identity course, taught online and accredited by the University of Massachusetts Lowell. He is Me pays for the course! Career: The Black Male Teacher Network is a virtual space for Black male teachers to connect, build community, and engage in identity-based professional development opportunities. Teachers are trained to facilitate affinity groups for their peers, college students, and high school students in our programs. Field-Building: The Building Black Male Teacher Pathways Summit convenes leaders in the education sector to reflect on their initiatives to inspire and support Black male teachers through collaboration. Our lifelong focus provides a clear pathway for Black males to become and remain teachers. As a result of our programs and partnerships, schools will recruit, retain, and retire more Black male teachers.
linkedin specialities: Teaching and Learning, Black Identity, Male Identity, Education, Mentorship, Leadership, social-emotional learning, SEL, training, development, teacher pipelines

summary: With 20+ years leading enterprise transformation, I specialize in driving sustainable, technology-enabled change for organizations in financial services, technology, and manufacturing. I am known for blending rigorous program governance with a people-first approach to deliver measurable, enduring results‚Äîeven amid fast-paced, high-stakes environments. Select Achievements: * Accelerated delivery by 50% for a $1B+ digital modernization and strategic partnership at TIAA, leveraging project fast-tracking and Agile sprints. * Directed organizational change management for a $300M global SAP rollout at Carrier, developing deployment blueprints and aligning headquarters with global finance for 34+ sites. * Drove fintech innovation at CGI by introducing the Distributed Ledger Payment Commitment (DLPC), adopted by the EU as an industry standard in 2022. * Led major post-merger integrations at Western Digital and Cisco Capital and launched one of the earliest global Supply Chain Finance programs at Seagate. * Co-Project Manager / Business Owner for IBM's legacy Global Credit Solution (GSC), which was successfully rolled out to 41 countries over 7 years with an annual budget of $10M. Having led over $2B in global transformation initiatives, I consistently help organizations unlock their full potential by fostering engagement, building resilient cultures, and aligning technology, people, and processes. summary: I started my career in merchant and investment banking. It was fast-paced and deal-driven, and I gained exposure to complex financial structures early on. But what always captured my attention wasn‚Äôt the capital side ‚Äî it was the operators. I was drawn to the builders, the entrepreneurs, the people in the trenches scaling something real. After working with several early-stage companies and briefly helping launch a hedge fund, I realized I loved the rhythm of small business ‚Äî but I needed more than passion; I needed process. A chance meeting with a seasoned fractional CFO and a copy of Traction by Gino Wickman opened my eyes. Finally, there was a framework that matched my instinct. In 2021, I joined a local firm in a junior CFO role. What began as a stepping stone quickly became a proving ground. I helped grow the client base, built internal systems, and took on leadership early. But like many entrepreneurial stories, what I helped build wasn‚Äôt mine to own. While at that firm, I met Chris Gauvin ‚Äî a Canadian, a CPA with a background in consulting and corporate finance. We couldn‚Äôt have had more different career paths. I came up through startups, Oklahoma State undergrad, and Dallas finance circles. He came through structured enterprise environments and had an MBA from the University of Texas. But we were in the same stage of life ‚Äî married, kids the same ages, both driven to build something lasting. That common ground ‚Äî vision, values, and a desire to finally have ownership in what we were building ‚Äî led us to launch Local Fractional. We built it for the founders we wish we‚Äôd served better before: the ones who need more than bookkeeping and backwards-looking reports. We offer nearshore-powered accounting foundations paired with strategic, fractional CFO leadership. We help you understand where you are AND where you‚Äôre going. We deliver monthly reports, KPI analysis, and forward-looking financial strategy ‚Äî but we don‚Äôt stop there. We‚Äôre building strategic AI tools that give founders 24/7 insight at their fingertips, because your best ideas don‚Äôt always come between 9 and 5. If you‚Äôre a founder building something real, we‚Äôd love to support your journey. -- If you want to go fast go alone, but if you want to go far go together --

linkedin description (4): What is a Contract Executive? A C-Suite Support contract executive is an executive who is adept at stepping into companies as a part-time executive, a temporary executive, an interim executive, a fractional executive, or as a consultant. We help you define what you need accomplished and in what period of time. We then find the right talent for your company and your need(s) from our extensive network. Part Time or Fractional Executive ‚Äì A part time executive role that is less than 5 days per week. A good example is a company that requires a senior-level marketing executive, but not every day. So C-Suite will match that company with a marketing executive who works for that company on contract for 1-3 days per week, for example, for the next 12 months. Interim Management Services or Temporary Executives ‚Äì A temporary or interim executive role that typically is 5 days per week for a short period of time to fill a gap between the departure of one key executive. Leading Key Initiatives, Leading Departments or Leading Companies C-Suite contract executives provide companies like yours with the skills and experience you need to implement new initiatives, develop new strategies for growth, carry out organizational or cultural change, manage complex projects, or fill business-critical roles currently vacant. Our network of contract executives includes experienced C-levels, Presidents, General Managers and Vice Presidents driving all major corporate functions. Our people typically report to the CEO or to the Board during their client engagement, no matter the title ‚Äì manager, director, VP, SVP, or Chief Executive Officer.

summary: I am a healing-centered coach, people & culture strategist, and storyteller who believes leadership is a love practice, trust is wealth, and accountability is the foundation of meaningful and lasting change. As Founder & Principal Consultant of In Loving Accountability Coaching & Consulting, I partner with purpose-driven leaders, teams, and organizations to close the gap between who they say they are and how they show up ‚Äî in policy, in practice, and in culture. My work is grounded in Black thought leadership, African-centered values, and a deep commitment to liberation as both a future vision and a present practice. Through offerings like Leadership as a L.O.V.E. Practice‚Ñ¢ and the Lineage & Legacy Recording Experience‚Ñ¢, I support Black leaders and changemakers with: -Building values-aligned cultures and teams -Practicing loving accountability with themselves and others -Designing systems, rituals, and learning experiences that honor our full humanity -Remembering the history, communities, stories, and experiences that shape how we lead and live For over a decade, I‚Äôve held roles across corporate, consulting, and social impact spaces ‚Äî from VP, Learning & Innovation in a global DEI firm to Fractional Equity, Diversity & Inclusion Officer at the Maryland Food Bank. Across every space, my throughline is the same: -Center Black experience and wisdom -Move from performative DEI to embodied equity -Create containers where leaders can tell the truth, repair harm, and imagine new ways of being Alongside my consulting work, I am the creator of Liberated Love Notes‚Ñ¢: Critical Self-Reflections and Affirmations for The Culture and host of the Liberated Love Notes podcast, which centers the experiences of Black folks existing in ‚Äî and healing from ‚Äî predominantly white spaces. A few ways I currently partner with leaders and organizations: -Fractional Equity & People/Culture leadership -Leadership as a L.O.V.E. Practice‚Ñ¢ labs & learning experiences -Team culture and retreat design -Coaching for Black leaders, founders, and DEI practitioners -Lineage & Legacy storytelling and recording experiences If you‚Äôre committed to building cultures and communities that reflect your values, strengthen your people, and leave a legacy ‚Äî I‚Äôd love to connect. summary: The PSC (People Strategy Consulting) Team I lead provides "Workplace and People Solutions". I also serve as a Leadership/Career Coach for other consulting firms. Our PSC Team's expertise can help your company by: Coaching & Developing Leaders & Key Associates: Individual coaching for emerging, developing and strategic leaders, as well as, key individual contributors, in one of two ways: (1) One-on-one with a designated professional coach for a 3-9 month period, where a leadership development plan is created and implemented, or (2) by "Just-in-Time" Coaching allowing a leader to obtain a one time or multiple coaching session and support from a professional coach on a "as needed and confidential basis" for a specific issue or situation. Developing High Performance Teams and Engaging Employees: A customized Team Coaching process over a series of Team sessions is developed based upon issues and concerns the team has, as well as to address any Team dysfunctions, which all teams must overcome! Keeping People in the Know: A plan is developed to engage the hearts and minds of your people through internal communications that inspires trust and secures commitment. linkedin description (3): The Leader Transition Institute prepares and walks beside people who are making pivots in their lives. Concurrently, we help small and large organizations maximize their abilities to communicate and lead, as well as improve their hiring process. We are a veteran-led 501(c)(3) organization supporting Federal and State Government customers in both CONUS and OCONUS locations. We provide training and coaching to help people - anyone, anywhere - who want to bridge the gap between where they are and where they want to be. For service members, veterans, and military spouses, Changing Focus: Moving From We to Me - 24 hours of hands on, interactive training over four days - fills the gap left by the Department of Defense mandated Transition Assistance Program that focuses only on future employment and post-service benefits. Our corporate training division provides leadership, communications, and diversity and inclusion training to both small and large organizations. In nearly three years, we've helped 150 people in 23 states, four countries and three continents learn about who they are as a person - aside from their rank or position and what they've already done in their life, they've become better communicators, and created a vision for themselves of the purposeful life they want for their future. We've also helped them improve their resumes so they've gotten job interviews, and increased their salaries by tens of thousands of dollars. We're proud that our participants tell us that in addition to everything else they learn from us, one of the important things they learn is that they're not alone. They tell us they're grateful to become part of a tribe that gets them. We're a young organization, but focused and excited for the future.

summary: Most capable leaders don‚Äôt struggle because they lack skill. They struggle because the same leadership capabilities that earned promotion stop scaling as complexity increases. Execution slows, not from effort, but from Leadership Operating System mismatch. As organizations grow, priorities shift faster, decisions become interdependent, and coordination costs rise. Strong leaders work harder, but results don‚Äôt compound the way they used to. This is rarely a performance issue. It‚Äôs a Leadership Operating System issue. I work with leaders and executive teams to identify where leadership systems built for more stable conditions are breaking under complexity and how to evolve them so execution regains clarity, speed, and resilience. My work focuses on upgrading how leaders think, decide, and operate together when scale, uncertainty, and pressure increase. Leadership Operating System Upgrades I Focus On ‚Ä¢ Escaping the Expert Trap Shifting from individual problem-solving to system-level leadership and decision architecture ‚Ä¢ Strategic Alignment Architecture Reducing decision latency and coordination friction across functions, teams, and stakeholders ‚Ä¢ Business Value Translation Ensuring leadership effort converts into strategic outcomes, not burnout or heroics Background I bring 20+ years of experience working across Asia, Europe, and the Americas, supporting leadership and organizational reinvention in complex, global environments. Former global talent and organizational development leader in Fortune 500 contexts, with experience advising senior leaders in large, matrixed organizations. How We Work ‚Ä¢ Leadership Operating System Diagnostic Brief (entry point) ‚Ä¢ Leadership OS Intelligence Mapping (by invitation) ‚Ä¢ Reinvention OS Lab (system-level execution upgrade) My work begins with diagnosis and focuses on system-level change that improves execution without relying on heroics. summary: You didn‚Äôt start your business to run every department. You had a vision. You saw a better way to serve customers, lead people, and grow something meaningful. Every new hire or process adds complexity, not clarity. That‚Äôs where I come in. I help Visionaries like you build real businesses, not high-paying jobs. As a Fractional Integrator and COO, I step in as your Second-in-Command. I bring structure to the chaos, create clarity around roles, and build systems that keep your team moving forward without constant input from you. I‚Äôve spent 25+ years doing this across industries: tech, telecom, construction, service, distribution, and several others. I‚Äôve led teams as an VP of Operations, Integrator, President, and COO. Today, I work with companies between $2M and $50M who are scaling fast and feeling the pressure. Most are running on EOS¬Æ and have an Implementer‚Ñ¢ or graduated from one. Here‚Äôs how we work together: 1. Clarify the structure ‚Äì Clarify your Accountability Chart so everyone knows who owns what. 2. Install discipline ‚Äì Use tools like scorecards, Rocks, and Meeting Rhythms that actually get traction. 3. Free you to lead ‚Äì Remove you from day-to-day ops so you can stay in your zone of genius. When the right operational structure is in place, everything changes. You get your time back. Your team gets aligned. And your business becomes something you can grow, scale, or even sell. Let‚Äôs turn your company into the business you originally set out to build. Based in Fairhope, AL - Available Nationwide

summary: In today‚Äôs business world, change is inevitable. Success is not. I help leaders and teams transform and excel during times of proactive and reactive change. With a mind for business and a heart for people, I've worked with dozens of companies to navigate change ‚Äì both at an individual level (via executive coaching) and from an organizational perspective (via team coaching, leadership development, training, internal communications, and business consulting). Together, we explore the dynamics of your unique situation, get perspective, organize solutions, break through barriers ‚Äì and ultimately, create results that make a difference. If credentials are important to you and the acronyms aren't too confusing, please know I'm a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) by the International Coaching Federation (ICF) and a Senior Certified Professional (SCP) by the Society for Human Resource Management (SHRM). summary: I‚Äôm building more than a business - I‚Äôm building a movement to redefine leadership at every stage of life. linkedin description (3): Glotman‚Ä¢Simpson Consulting Engineers is one of North America‚Äôs leading engineering firms, providing innovative structural engineering solutions and unparalleled client service since 1964. education school linkedin description (2: Established in 1980, Erickson has trained over 75,000+ professional coaches and is represented in over 217 cities across 6 continents. Since its inception, Erickson has pioneered transformational change in individuals and organizations using a methodology of coaching techniques informed by neuroscience that are action-based and future-focused. Above all, Erickson is committed to empowering people by placing emphasis on solutions rather than problems. With a strong track record of implementing long lasting positive change in Fortune 500 companies such as SAP and Google, Erickson has earned a reputation as one of the most recognized human development institutes in the world. Our world renowned training program The Art & Science Of Coaching offers a highly acclaimed and ICF-certified curriculum, and prepares you to be a professional life coach, executive coach, or business coach. Our personal and professional development courses offer CCEU credits, and a variety of focused areas for deeper self-exploration and growth that are applicable both in and out of the professional working world. Erickson coaching credentials are recognized globally as the highest quality of training, and our alumni continue to uphold this gold standard. For organizations, Erickson is a committed partner, facilitating the development of resilient, inclusive and successful company cultures. We do this through organizational training, internal coach development and coach placement services. Courses are offered on-site and online via our virtual online learning platform and our robust global alumni network of coaches and leaders are continuously engaged and developed through our complimentary alumni app, Erickson+. Erickson's true strength lies in its global community of trainers, facilitators and professional coaches. Connect with us today to -become a certified coach and gain a global credential -implement tangible change in your organization -grow personally and professionally

summary: Fourteen years ago, I relearned how to walk. That experience is the foundation of my work today. It taught me what it truly takes to perform under max pressure. Now, I partner with organizations to help their people and teams in high-stakes, dynamic environments become totally unshakeable. My journey started during my recovery when I discovered a passion for the human side of performance. This led me to a stint in journalism, covering the inner workings of Major League Baseball player development for NPR. Being on the ground gave me a deep understanding of the complexity, ambiguity and risk that leaders and staff in pro sports and entertainment face every day. Then I launched my own practice, How We Won. Now I serve as the long-term strategic partner to talent at organizations in the most demanding industries, helping them build the personal and team resiliency to create winning leadership and cultures. I've delivered over 4,500 sessions to employees at top companies like Google, American Express and Warner Bros. Discovery. I‚Äôm an ICF Professional Certified Coach (PCC), Master Certified Coach (MCC) applicant, and QE Executive Certified Coach (ECC). I also have a B.S. in Psychology. I believe an individual's personal strength and health are the most important drivers of an organization‚Äôs success. ‚ÄúKim is more than a coach. She's a strategic partner. She has a unique ability to help you peel back the layers of complex, multi-faceted challenges until you find the core issue. I went into our work feeling overwhelmed and left with a profound sense of clarity and peace. She doesn't just help you solve problems. She helps you see that you were never broken to begin with.‚Äù - VP, Global Partnerships at a Fortune 100 Company My services are optimized for organizational needs and include: Trainings, Workshops and Coaching (Executive, Team, Leadership, Onboarding, Career Path, Shadowing).

summary: I believe leadership is learned in practice. It‚Äôs built through awareness, connection, and the confidence to show up with intention, even when the path isn‚Äôt clear. This shapes how I‚Äôve led and built leadership and talent development for 2 decades. In my seasoned career, I‚Äôve designed and led leadership development, performance management, and career path initiatives across organizations at different stages of growth. I partner closely with executives, HR leaders, and managers to strengthen the everyday moments that define leadership: setting direction, giving feedback, navigating ambiguity, and supporting people through change. Through FutureForm, I work with leaders and teams to develop three timeless leadership capabilities: Clarity - Helping leaders focus on what matters most and communicate it so teams can move with confidence. Connection - Building trust, psychological safety, and real understanding between leaders and their teams. Confidence - Supporting leaders to lead with steadiness, humility, and authenticity, without relying on control. Career clarity is a core part of this work. When leaders and employees understand their strengths, values, and direction, performance improves, engagement deepens, and retention follows. Clarity at the individual level strengthens leadership at the organizational level. Alongside my work with FutureForm, I‚Äôm open to senior leadership or advisory roles where I can build, evolve, or scale leadership and talent systems rooted in human-centered, practical leadership. If you believe leadership is the lever for what comes next, I‚Äôd welcome the conversation.
linkedin description: Leaders today are navigating relentless change but without the time or support to grow in place. At FutureForm, we help leaders and organizations grow at the pace of change - without losing what makes them human. Our work build the systems and mindsets that fuel confident, connected, and future-ready leadership. Because when people grow, leadership strengthens, and organizations transform.

education school linkedin description (1: The George Washington University, an independent academic institution chartered by the Congress of the United States in 1821, dedicates itself to furthering human well-being. The University values a dynamic, student-focused community stimulated by cultural and intellectual diversity and built upon a foundation of integrity, creativity, and openness to the exploration of new ideas. The George Washington University, centered in the national and international crossroads of Washington, D.C., commits itself to excellence in the creation, dissemination, and application of knowledge. By fostering excellence in teaching, the University offers outstanding learning experiences for full-time and part-time students in undergraduate, graduate, and professional programs in Washington, D.C., the nation, and abroad. As a center for intellectual inquiry and research, the University emphasizes the linkage between basic and applied scholarship, insisting that the practical be grounded in knowledge and theory. The University acts as a catalyst for creativity in the arts, the sciences, and professions by encouraging interaction among its students, faculty, staff, alumni, and the communities it serves. The George Washington University draws upon the rich array of resources from the National Capital Area to enhance its educational endeavors. In return, the University, through its students, faculty, staff, and alumni, contributes talent and knowledge to improve the quality of life in metropolitan Washington, D.C.

summary: By the age of 22, I'd: - Founded 4 businesses and sold 1 - Founded 2 non-profits and been program director at a 3rd - Directly mentored 300+ young entrepreneurs - Been appointed to faculty of an Ivy League University - Published 2 books Naturally, when I graduated from Brown, I had no interest in getting a job. But I had to make a living, so I founded a marketing agency. I worked with B2B service businesses, and promised them what everyone does. More marketing means: - More leads - More clients - More revenue Long story short, that didn't happen. I wasn't getting results because my approach was wrong. I noticed: Like most businesses, when B2B service firms want more clients, they invest in marketing. They chase cold leads, lose a ton of money, and wonder why nothing's working. So rather than being yet another run-of-the-mill marketing agency, I pivoted. Now, I build infrastructure to get more referrals. Why? It's the cheapest, fastest, and most effective way for a B2B service firm to grow. WHAT I BUILD: Referable Brand ‚Üí Positioning and messaging so clients know exactly who to refer to you Validation-Ready Digital Presence ‚Üí Website and LinkedIn optimized for referral confidence, not SEO traffic Relationship CRM ‚Üí Automated touchpoints that keep your network warm and generate systematic referrals WHO THIS IS FOR: Established B2B service firms ($500K-$5M) with 20+ client relationships but no system to leverage them. Consulting firms, agencies, coaches. WHY REFERRALS ARE BETTER: - They convert 71% higher than paid leads - They close 69% faster - Retention rates are 37% higher You might worry about being dependent on referrals. Odds are, you're not dependent ENOUGH. I've built infrastructure for 20+ clients in the past year‚Äîcreative agencies, solo consultants, coaches, EOS implementers, even a catering company. Ready to do what ACTUALLY works? Book a free 60-minute strategy session. I'll tell you how to sign 5 new clients without spending a dime. (It's not magic, it's referrals)
job description: I help B2B founders build client acquisition systems rooted in relationships, not lead generation. Services: - CRM design & implementation (built for trust, not tracking) - LinkedIn & outreach strategy (conversations, not cold pitching) - Marketing automation (that feels human) - Fractional CMO services Approach: Unlike traditional consultants who hand you templates, I design custom systems based on the psychology of relationships. This leads to 3x more referrals, 37% higher retention, and businesses founders actually love running. Who I work with: B2B founders, consultants, agencies, and service providers tired of pushy sales tactics.
linkedin description: At Scurry Consulting, we help entrepreneurs build better businesses by designing simple, effective systems that support sustainable growth. We work with founders who have vision, traction, and drive‚Äîbut lack the structure to scale with confidence. We specialize in three things: 1. Sales Funnels that Convert 2. CRMs that Work for You 3. Strategic Plans that Clarify What to Do Next Founded by Mason Scurry at 22, Scurry Consulting is not your average consulting firm. We‚Äôre not slow, corporate, or bloated. We‚Äôre fast, focused, and deeply invested in your success. Mason‚Äôs journey started early: ‚Äì At 16, he co-founded a nonprofit and built a team of 120 volunteers in two weeks. ‚Äì At 18, he accidentally launched a business that was acquired within two years. ‚Äì At 21, he published his second book. And during his final semester at Brown University, he made the call to skip the safe path and build Scurry Consulting from scratch. No stability. No safety net. Just a commitment to help others build meaningful, profitable companies. Within four months: ‚Äì 10 clients signed ‚Äì 2 interns hired ‚Äì $7,000/month in pre-commission revenue The systems that got him there are the same ones we now implement for clients. Our work is grounded in strategy, not fluff. We don‚Äôt sell shiny templates or one-size-fits-all solutions. We dig deep into how your business actually works, and then we help you design better ways to sell, serve, and scale. We work best with founders who are willing to think hard, work fast, and challenge their own assumptions. People who want clarity, not just clicks. People who want to move forward, not spin their wheels. If you‚Äôre that kind of founder, we‚Äôd love to work with you. Let‚Äôs build something that lasts.

linkedin description (2): Located in historic Providence, Rhode Island and founded in 1764, Brown University is the seventh-oldest college in the United States. Brown is an independent, coeducational Ivy League institution comprising undergraduate and graduate programs, plus the Alpert Medical School, School of Public Health, School of Engineering, and the School of Professional Studies. With its talented and motivated student body and accomplished faculty, Brown is a leading research university that maintains a particular commitment to exceptional undergraduate instruction. Brown‚Äôs vibrant, diverse community consists of about 6,200 undergraduates, 2,000 graduate students, 490 medical school students, more than 5,000 summer, visiting, and online students, and over 700 faculty members. Brown students come from all 50 states and more than 115 countries. Undergraduates pursue bachelor‚Äôs degrees in more than 70 concentrations, ranging from Egyptology to cognitive neuroscience. Anything‚Äôs possible at Brown‚Äîthe university‚Äôs commitment to undergraduate freedom means students must take responsibility as architects of their courses of study. Brown University has 51 doctoral programs and 28 master‚Äôs programs. The broad scope of options vary from interdisciplinary opportunities in molecular pharmacology and physiology to a master‚Äôs program in acting and directing through the Brown/Trinity Repertory Consortium. Around the world, nearly 90,000 Brown alumni are - in the words of Brown‚Äôs charter - leading lives of ‚Äúusefulness and reputation‚Äù in every imaginable field of endeavor. Through events around the globe, reunions on campus, career resources, a host of online connections, and other services, the Brown Alumni Association fosters and supports a vibrant alumni community, wherever its members may be.

With its talented and motivated student body and accomplished faculty, Brown is a leading research university that maintains a particular commitment to exceptional undergraduate instruction. Brown‚Äôs vibrant, diverse community consists of about 6,200 undergraduates, 2,000 graduate students, 490 medical school students, more than 5,000 summer, visiting, and online students, and over 700 faculty members. Brown students come from all 50 states and more than 115 countries. Undergraduates pursue bachelor‚Äôs degrees in more than 70 concentrations, ranging from Egyptology to cognitive neuroscience. Anything‚Äôs possible at Brown‚Äîthe university‚Äôs commitment to undergraduate freedom means students must take responsibility as architects of their courses of study. Brown University has 51 doctoral programs and 28 master‚Äôs programs. The broad scope of options vary from interdisciplinary opportunities in molecular pharmacology and physiology to a master‚Äôs program in acting and directing through the Brown/Trinity Repertory Consortium. summary: If you're reading this, you're curious. Curious people are intelligent people. I thrive on curiousity. My summary used to be the same-old rote descriptions of all the things I thought I was. It included words like "strategic", "collaborator", "leadership-driven", "people-centric", and so on‚Ä¶ I AM all those things but what about the PERSON behind the ROLE? Where did she go, I wonder? Well, a COMPLETE burnout in HR during the pandemic and two, yes two, subsequent layoffs in two years, I'm finally free of the constraints our modern workplace norms have become. I would now describe myself as a former Human Resource professional who woke up one day and had enough of the games, the politicking, working the grind for someone else only to be a cog in the wheel. It became untenable. I was reminded that we really can only control the "controllables"... ... how we respond to change, the integrity with which we handle ourselves, how we manage our home & finances, how we take care of and love those who we love, and ultimately where/when/how we steward the gifts and time we've been given. Jobs will come and go but who you are in the in-between matters most. I recently read a famous quote that made my stomach turn and my pulse race ..."The majority of people die at 35 but aren't buried until 75" - I see what this represents all around me and have my whole career. People on autopilot, no self-reflecting, not thriving, not clear on their God-given purpose and direction. I believe God wants better for you and for me. You have a LOVELY calling ... ready to discover what that is? Follow my journey: The Making of Something Lovely @ www.lovelycalling.com

education school linkedin description (1: The University of Portland was founded in September 1901 by Portland Archbishop Alexander Christie, who had purchased property atop Waud‚Äôs Bluff with financial assistance from the Congregation of Holy Cross in South Bend, Indiana. Archbishop Christie named the school ‚ÄúColumbia University‚Äù after the mighty river that flowed nearby, and when it opened its doors, it was staffed with priests from the archdiocese. Columbia University achieved junior college status in 1922, and in 1925 the College of Arts and Sciences was founded. Four years later the first bachelor‚Äôs degrees were awarded to a class of seven men. In the 1930s, the University‚Äôs name was changed to the University of Portland, the St. Vincent Hospital School of Nursing became part of the University as the College of Nursing, and the School of Business were created. In 1948, the School of Engineering was created. The University established its Graduate School in 1950 and the School of Education in 1962. In 1967 the Congregation of Holy Cross and the University‚Äôs Board of Regents transitioned to a shared governance structure. Today, the University continues to be guided by the Congregation of Holy Cross and governed by an independent board of directors. The University of Portland is the only school in Oregon to offer a College of Arts & Sciences, a graduate school, and nationally accredited programs in the schools of business, education, engineering, and nursing. In 2013, University of Portland was named one of America's "Green Colleges"‚Äã for the fourth consecutive year by The Princeton Review. In 2013, U.S. News and World Report named the University of Portland one of the top ten Western regional universities. The University has been named a top ten regional university for 19 years running. In 2012, the University of Portland ranked first nationwide among master‚Äôs institutions with the number of students who won Fulbright awards for the third consecutive year, according to The Chronicl...

summary: I‚Äôm an Organizational & People Strategy consultant who partners with founders, leaders, and teams to build the systems, behaviors, and cultures that support sustainable, human-centered growth. After more than two decades in People & Culture and HR leadership roles ‚Äî from start-ups to public companies ‚Äî I shifted my work to focus on what I‚Äôm most passionate about: helping organizations strengthen their foundations, develop purposeful leaders and teams, and navigate growth with clarity and intention. I support clients through strategic consulting, leadership and team development, facilitation, coaching, advisory work, and, when needed, fractional support. My work often centers around: ‚Ä¢ Organizational, business & culture strategy ‚Ä¢ Leadership, team & culture development ‚Ä¢ People systems and foundational HR infrastructure ‚Ä¢ Performance & feedback frameworks ‚Ä¢ Coaching, facilitation & talent development ‚Ä¢ Employee experience & engagement My approach blends strategy with humanity and is shaped by several practical and research-backed frameworks. I use the Five Facets of Business‚Ñ¢ to help leaders look holistically at their organization, and I integrate principles from Appreciative Inquiry and Intentional Change Theory into my leadership and team development work as I continue expanding my practice in these areas. I complement this with behavioral tools such as Tilt365, DISC, Motivators, and The Six Working Geniuses to support self-awareness, communication, and effective collaboration across teams. I frequently work with early-stage and growth-minded organizations, particularly in tech and professional services, while remaining open to meaningful work in new environments. ü§ù I partner best with leaders who value clarity, collaboration, and intentional growth. ‚ú® Certified in Tilt365, DISC, Motivators & multiple leadership development tools üéì Pursuing a Master‚Äôs in Leadership & Organizational Change (CWRU) üé§ Available for speaking, workshops, coaching, consulting, advisory, and fractional engagements üì© Let‚Äôs connect if you‚Äôre navigating growth, culture, or leadership transitions.

summary: Carol is a transformative executive coach, strategic advisor and consultant whose 30+ year career has been defined by an unwavering commitment to helping people, teams and organizations unlock their fullest potential. She has a rare blend of operational acumen, cultural intelligence, and instinct for transformation and turns complex ideas into actionable insights, asking tough and helpful questions, and creating positive environments where dialogue drives progress. Carol has navigated complexity of large-scale change, leading with empathy, clarity and a result-oriented mindset. She has led, mentored and sponsored thousands of diverse leaders and teams as they faced into and progressed successfully through change. With a professional foundation laid at Johnson & Johnson, Carol served in multiple VP, Human Resources/Management Board roles in Pharmaceuticals, Consumer Products, and Medical Technology. She provided trusted counsel to leaders in and across Commercial, R&D, Supply Chain, and Corporate functions. Carol built/led high performing, diverse HR teams in Business Partner and Specialist roles including Global Leadership Development and D&I. Carol is President of New Hope Coaching where she partners with individuals, professional service providers and global, large/mid-scale companies in Pharmaceuticals, Biotech, Consumer, Retail, Manufacturing, and Provider/Delivery. She is curious, learns quickly, and is interested in new business segments. Carol delivers 1:1 executive coaching for Presidents, /S-VPs, and Sr. Directors in an array of discipline areas, in addition to executive leadership team advising/consulting. M.S. in Organizational Development from American University/NTL Certified: Board Certified Coach (BCC), Center for Executive Coaching, CEC Team Coaching, Hogan Leadership Assessments, Prosci Change Management Carol thrives on meaningful connections with family, friends, and colleagues, loves animals, enjoys discovering new places, meeting new people, and playing a fun round of golf. Her belief in the power of people, the promise of potential and the beauty of possibility is not just a mission statement ‚Äì it‚Äôs how she lives, leads and inspires others.

summary: A recognized B2B growth expert and coach, I help B2B leaders accelerate & de-risk growth through strategic market innovation. CONTACT ME for a complimentary consultation at 216.333.4569 or Kelly@LawrenceInnovation.com. I'm the one people call to deliver new business growth. With over 20 years of experience spanning Fortune 500 companies, privately held businesses, and startups, I'm grateful to have partnered with global leaders and coached hundreds of team members to drive top and bottom-line growth while unlocking new business opportunities: strategy to execution. I strive for continuous learning, so it's an honor to serve as a contributing author to WhatTheyThink, an AIM Institute coach and Innoquest community member. I've enjoyed the learning that has come from authoring globally recognized market reports and working with global teams over the years. I am thrilled to share insights with others who share the vision of improving organic growth processes and results. When you choose to work with me, you gain a partner who cares about growing your business just as much as you do. Specializing in strategic market innovation, my boutique advisory firm helps B2B leaders de-risk and accelerate organic growth for long-term sustainable business results. My approach is recognized for delivering value-driven partnerships and measurable ROI. I am humbled that my clients who collectively represent over $120 billion in annual revenue, partner with me to solve real-world problems that make a significant impact. ORGANIC GROWTH EXPERTISE From initial market assessment through demand creation, I help you analyze your unique situation and develop practical action plans to accelerate organic growth. I also help teams build stronger competency in front-end-of innovation processes for higher hit rates. Before founding Lawrence Innovation, I delivered impactful innovation results at Fortune Brands' Moen and Berkshire Hathaway's Lubrizol. My teams typically have a hit rate upwards of 60% versus industry averages of under 5%. What would it do for you if you could improve your hit rate by 10x? MY VISION Walt Disney said, "If you dream it, you can do it." I say, of course you can, but make sure it matters to your customers before you build it. MAKING IT MATTER Passionate about making the world a better place, I live and play in Greater Cleveland, Ohio with my husband and two daughters - my why. I relish learning new things. Hobbies include traveling, standup paddle boarding, hiking with my pal Zeke (English Black Labrador), baking, & reading.
job description: Lawrence Innovation, LLC helps B2B leaders accelerate & de-risk growth through strategic market innovation. We and our partners provide end-to-end-strategic-marketing support from fuzzy front-end-of-innovation opportunity analysis to value delivery through: Consulting: Opportunity analysis, value proposition clarity, and go-to-market strategy to seize new growth opportunities. Training: Build internal excellence with our training programs in Strategic Marketing, Innovation, and Value Selling. Coaching & Facilitation: Executive coaching, strategic planning, and de-risking facilitation to sharpen decision-making and execution. Fractional Support: On-demand strategic marketing and new business development expertise when you need it most. Our clients learn how to stay in touch with customers through deep dialogue, develop the right offers, develop and communicate unique value propositions and nail a profitable business model with proven revenue streams. When you work with us, you get high caliber strategic marketing and business development as a variable cost. We operate as an independent consultancy with strategic alliances for zero overhead. This means you get real business growth expertise and the tools of a large firm at significantly lower costs with greater flexibility versus hiring full-time employees. We bring direct experience across B2B industries including: digital printing, textiles, packaging, chemicals, building products and C-level education in financial services. Contact us when you are ready to scale or need to pivot.

summary: As a strategic advisor, coach, and consultant, I help business owners, founders, and managing partners simplify complexity, create clarity, and drive sustainable growth. I work with professional service firms, consumer product brands, manufacturing businesses, construction companies, and technology firms to develop and implement actionable strategies that fuel revenue growth, enhance profitability, and build high-performing teams. WHY MY EXPERIENCE MATTERS TO YOUR BUSINESS: I spent my career leading marketing, sales, and business development for well-known consumer brands and manufacturing firms. While my expertise began in consumer-driven industries, the principles of growth, positioning, and strategy apply universally and are just as critical for professional service firms as they are for consumer brands. Professional service firms struggle with differentiation, client acquisition, and scaling. Consumer brands focus on creating emotional connections, brand loyalty, and effective go-to-market strategies. My expertise blends both, helping professional service firms apply consumer-driven insights to win more business while guiding consumer brands to develop lasting market impact. HOW I HELP: ‚úî Growth Strategy & Positioning ‚Äì Establishing a compelling market position that drives demand and revenue. ‚úî Leadership & Team Optimization ‚Äì Helping owners develop leadership skills, structure strong teams, and build a results-driven culture. ‚úî Sales & Marketing Acceleration ‚Äì Driving lead generation, conversion, and long-term customer engagement. ‚úî Business Efficiency & Financial Strategy ‚Äì Identifying key operational efficiencies to improve profitability and scale effectively. ‚úî Exit & Transition Planning ‚Äì Preparing businesses for leadership transitions, mergers, or sales to maximize value. REAL RESULTS, REAL IMPACT: ‚úÖ Transformed professional service firms by refining messaging, improving operations, and increasing client acquisition. ‚úÖ Led go-to-market strategies that drove multimillion-dollar growth for national and global consumer brands. ‚úÖ Revitalized declining industries through strategic branding and marketing that increased market share and profitability. ‚úÖ Helped business owners scale and exit by positioning their companies for sustainable growth and maximum valuation.
