summary: I'm Kat, a Finnish-American ICF-certified executive and leadership team coach, facilitator, and speaker with 25+ years of experience in global organizational and leadership development. I help leaders and organizations create a culture of inclusion and psychological safety where innovation thrives. My master‚Äôs degree in Mental Health Counseling informs my holistic, research-backed coaching framework. Together, we explore new perspectives and identify solutions for growth and success as well as health and well-being. In 1998, I moved from my native Finland to New York City. I was the first in my family to earn a college degree and, like many others, I craved the energy, inspiration, and diversity of life in NYC. I held career services and HR & development roles before founding my independent coaching practice. My expertise lies in international and highly-demanding professional contexts‚Äîsince founding my practice, my work has taken me to Helsinki, Rome, Bangkok, and Bonn and I‚Äôve worked with leaders based across six continents. Sisu‚Äîthe Finnish concept of resilience‚Äîand my own personal experiences as an immigrant have deeply influenced my coaching philosophy. My approach to coaching is built upon a core belief in our human capacity to learn and grow, to succeed through challenges, and live and lead with purpose. Alongside my coaching practice, I am an experienced senior non-profit founder and board leader. I have founded, led, and developed several global and local non-profit community organizations over the past 30 years. After I moved to NYC, I founded two non-profit organizations with and for Nordic women. I have served as vice-president for a global non-profit FIGT.org, and the local Finnish American Chamber of Commerce in NYC. I led the Chatham High School Marching Band Club, a registered 501c3, as President for several years. As a leader, I am driven by my values to make a difference by strengthening communities through engagement. In all my leadership experiences, I have improved the performance and structure of the board‚ÄîI am a skilled organizer known for getting things done. I lead with a strong vision and clear goals while building engagement and motivation through communication and relationship building. Want to learn more about working with me as your executive or team coach and facilitator? Send me a note!

education school linkedin description (1: This is a general information page for U of T's New College. BUT are you one of our alumni? A current New college student? For you to be included under the Students & Alumni tab on this general page, the school in your profile must be "University of Toronto - New College". Opened in 1962, New is one of the youngest and most modern of the St. George Campus colleges at the University of Toronto. It has developed its own traditions and identity, focusing on personal attention to students, innovative interdisciplinary programs, links with the professional faculties, career mentorship and community outreach initiatives. New is a friendly and informal community which places a high priority on student support services and encourages diversity. From admission to graduation, and then as alumni, our students are encouraged to think of the college as their home base and to take full advantage of its many services and activities. A university career involves a series of choices and the Registrar‚Äôs Office at New is always ready to help with information and advice. Most New College students are enrolled in the Faculty of Arts and Science, proceeding toward an Honours Bachelor of Arts, Science or Commerce degree. About 5,000 are currently registered, of whom 1,250 or so are first-year students. The College Residence community brings together Arts and Science students with members from the professional faculties, such as Engineering, Kinesiology and Physical Education and Music. The wide range of interests represented by our students makes membership in New College an education in itself. New offers a spirited and challenging environment in which students have the opportunity to broaden their experience, even to create their life plans, through meeting others from different fields. The College reflects, on a more personal level, the variety and interaction of the University as a whole.

summary: You know that complex but rewarding part of leadership: i.e. people? That‚Äôs where we come in. At PeopleFirst, we help leaders create environments where people feel valued, connected, and empowered, because when you put your people first, the results naturally follow. PeopleFirst is a collective of experienced, purpose-driven professionals who share a passion for transforming workplaces into spaces where people bring their best selves to life and work. We partner with HR and business leaders, particularly in small to mid-sized organizations (20‚Äì2000 employees), who want access to proven methodologies trusted by Fortune 500 companies. Our signature journey is one that goes from Awareness to Alignment through Achievement It all begins with self-awareness, using a powerful combination of Insights Discovery, 360¬∞ feedback tools from the Center for Creative Leadership, and executive coaching. These proven approaches help individuals understand themselves and their colleagues, fostering more respectful, productive, and positive working relationships, in person or across geographies. Alignment dives deeper into how teams function. We work on team effectiveness, leadership development, hybrid and distributed teams, change management, and other critical areas to ensure teams are not just aware, but cohesive, agile, and ready to deliver lasting impact. The Achievement phase teams are thriving, leadership is empowered, and organizations are operating with clarity and confidence. PeopleFirst is your trusted advisor. We provide ongoing strategic support to help organizations sustain momentum, deepen impact, and continue growing independently. We don't just train your people, we transform your organization, fostering meaningful improvements in trust, clarity, connection, and collaboration. Because when your teams work better together, results naturally follow. If you're a leader who values putting people first and seeks impactful, sustainable change, let‚Äôs connect. Or maybe you just want to discuss the best boating, fishing spot or bike trail in Nova Scotia!

summary: With a doctorate in clinical psychology and extensive studies, experience, and practice in corporate coaching and consultancy, Dr. Andy Garrett is at the forefront of a revolutionary movement towards personal growth and optimization. He earned his doctoral degree from the Graduate Psychology program at Azusa Pacific University. Their theoretical emphasis on Systems theory and unique holistic integration philosophy helped him to become very effective in conceptualizing and implementing strategic growth plans for individuals, families, and corporations. Dr. Andy uniquely emphasizes a positive psychology approach that utilizes established individual, familial, and organizational strengths rather than underscoring what may be pathological or dysfunctional. In blending this approach with a systems theoretical model, existential psychology, and solution-focused strategies, he's empowered to provide a transformative brand of coaching and consulting. Throughout his career, he‚Äôs contributed a significant and meaningful role as a consultant for multiple faith-based organizations - where he specializes in empowering his clients to discover and establish their True North identity, purpose, and community - and then integrate radically resilient principles, practices, and strategies - that enable his clients to consistently achieve their biggest goals and actualize their greatest potential. Dr. Andy has made a considerable impact working as a performance coach for high performing executives, elite athletes, and organizations throughout Southern California - and beyond (his online coaching curriculum has been effectively utilized and taught throughout the US - and even in select European countries). Dr. Andy has developed a thriving private practice in the renowned Newport Beach area, and he offers custom private workshops, corporate training programs, he is a highly sought after speaker and podcast guest, and he continues to offer concierge style coaching services (although - openings with Dr. Andy are rare to come by - so, if you are interested in working with him one on one - you should get on his waiting list ASAP!).

job description (4): Thank you for taking the opportunity to get to know me and my approach to psychotherapy. My name is Andy Garrett (my patient‚Äôs typically refer to me as Dr. G or Dr. Andy) and I am excited to be joining the Connolly Counseling Group practice. As a clinician ‚Äì I believe that therapy should help you access the best part of yourself, enhance the overall quality and sense of satisfaction in your life, and remove the emotional barriers that are holding you back from achieving your goals. In this process you will gain the capacity and confidence to establish relationships that are meaningful, fulfilling, and lasting. Over the course of completing my doctoral studies and clinical training at Azusa Pacific University ‚Äì I developed a unique style of psychotherapy which has proven to be highly effective. I have worked in some of the most reputable psychiatric hospitals, outpatient clinics, educational institutions, and private practice settings in Southern California. These opportunities have allowed me the privilege of working with a diverse population of adolescents, adults, couples, and families. I have developed specific interests and training in treating psychological issues that include anxiety, depression, life transitions, addictions (including substance abuse related issues, food addictions, and compulsive gambling), faith/religious distress, and grief. I can also provide psychological testing services for diagnostic purposes, academic testing, premarital enrichment, and occupational enhancement. In summary, it would be my privilege to join you on your journey towards self-discovery and personal growth. In the process you will experience a collaborative relationship that is both supportive and affirming‚Äìand I will help you achieve the absolute best quality of life that you truly deserve. In taking that courageous first step and reaching out for help, you can change the course of your life forever‚Ä¶and for the better! Supervisor: Bob Connolly, Psy.D.

I also created CollabCode‚Ñ¢, a structural methodology and certification pathway for practitioners who want to build and sustain collaboration as an operating discipline. Not personality. education school linkedin description (1: Eastern Kentucky University (http://www.eku.edu) boasts a rich heritage of outstanding service to the region and Commonwealth of Kentucky. The origins of what is now EKU can be traced to the 1874 founding of Central University in Richmond. The roots of present-day Eastern go back to 1906 with the establishment of Eastern Kentucky State Normal School No. 1 on the old Central University campus. In 1922 it became a four-year institution and changed its name to the Eastern Kentucky State Normal School and Teachers College, awarding its first degrees under that name in 1925. The school received accreditation from the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools in 1928; then, two years later, in 1930, it changed its name again to the Eastern Kentucky State Teachers College. Eastern added graduate studies in 1935, and thirteen years later, in 1948, the General Assembly removed the word Teachers from the school's name, and granted it the right to award nonprofessional degrees. It was not until 1966 that the school was officially renamed Eastern Kentucky University. In 2010, the University awarded its first doctoral degree -- in Educational Leadership and Policy Studies. Dr. David T. McFaddin is the University's 14th President.

summary: I‚Äôm an entrepreneur and small business trainer who‚Äôs spent the past 25+ years helping other entrepreneurs build and grow successful businesses. My mission is simple: make business education clear, actionable, and inspiring so entrepreneurs can thrive. Through webinars, workshops, and one-on-one advising, I share lessons I‚Äôve learned from running my own businesses‚Äîwhat works, what doesn‚Äôt, and how to keep moving forward no matter what challenges come your way. Core Skills I Help Business Owners Master: ‚Ä¢ Creating practical business plans ‚Ä¢ Pricing products/services profitably and understanding break-even points ‚Ä¢ Marketing using free and low-cost tools (online and offline) ‚Ä¢ Cash flow forecasting and financial management ‚Ä¢ Time management, goal setting, and building systems ‚Ä¢ Hiring, training, and motivating small teams Popular Workshops & Programs: ‚Ä¢ Financials for Non-Financial Small Business Owners ‚Ä¢ Low-Cost Marketing Tools to Grow Your Business ‚Ä¢ Create a Business Plan That Gets Results ‚Ä¢ Profitably Price Your Products + Break-Even Analysis ‚Ä¢ One-Page Business Model and Marketing Plan ‚Ä¢ Recruit, Train, and Motivate Your Team Flagship Program: How to Run Your Own Business (5-Day Course) This hands-on course covers: ‚Ä¢ Business modeling, planning, and funding ‚Ä¢ Bookkeeping, taxes, and financial statements ‚Ä¢ Marketing and PR strategies ‚Ä¢ Operations and systems ‚Ä¢ Real-world stories that motivate and inspire I work closely with small business enterprise centres, economic development agencies, and government programs to deliver practical, results-driven training that makes a real impact. summary: I‚Äôm passionate about promoting entrepreneurship, economic development, and community engagement in Detroit. My expertise and research primarily focuses on the impact of support organizations such as workforce training and development programs, accelerators, incubators, co-working spaces, startup studios, corporate innovation initiatives and community building events. My strategic consultancy helps nonprofits, startups, and mission-driven businesses transform their vision into sustainable impact and scale with confidence. Projects span strategic operations, program design, talent development, community activation and growth strategy. Alongside this work, I enjoy coaching founders, mentoring emerging leaders, and teaching the next generation of entrepreneurs. I also am a Lecturer at University of Michigan teaching Negotiation to undergrads. I am Co-founder and Partner of Venture Catalysts, a nonprofit focused on building an inclusive entrepreneurial ecosystem in Detroit through events like Detroit Startup Week (10,000+ attendees), AfroTech (largest black tech conference), and Backstage Capital Accelerator (investing in underrepresented, or rather underestimated, founders). Previously I was the Head of Founder Network and Operations for Tenney 110, a portfolio of adjacent businesses and venture studio within American Family Insurance. Prior to that I founded the Desai Accelerator, an intensive program of funding, mentorship, and resources to help early stage ventures scale and succeed. As Managing Director, I recruited and managed investments in 11 tech enabled businesses, including MySwimPro (named 2016 Apple Watch App of the Year), Ash & Erie (featured on Shark Tank) and Companion (recognized by the Today Show, Good Morning America). Over the past several years, I have worked with a variety of startup companies at the Boston-based investment fund TechStars and at the early stage venture capital fund Invest Detroit Ventures. In 2015 I was named Crains Detroit Business "40 under 40" and ‚Äú25 Women in Tech.‚Äù

summary: Most organizations are drowning in tools they don't need, solving for problems they haven't defined. I help small businesses and nonprofits get aligned before AI, build structure before scale, and create systems that serve people‚Äînot the other way around. THE PROBLEM Leaders buy systems before documenting their sales process. They buy automation before clarifying workflow. They chase AI before knowing what problems they're solving. Result? Expensive technology that creates chaos, not clarity. The tech industry profits from this confusion. I don't. ALIGNED BEFORE AI I published a book by this title because I'm tired of watching businesses waste money on premature technology. CLARITY BEFORE COMPLEXITY ‚Äì Before tools, we clarify what you're trying to accomplish. Until you can articulate this, no software will save you. STRUCTURE BEFORE SCALE ‚Äì You cannot automate chaos. If processes are broken, AI breaks them faster. We build documented workflows first, then introduce technology. HUMANS BEFORE HYPE ‚Äì AI amplifies what exists. Confused teams get more confused. Aligned teams become force multipliers. WHAT I'VE BUILT As Founder of Align & Innovate, I provide fractional Chief AI & Systems Officer services to organizations needing strategic technology leadership. Before that, I co-founded Visuals by Momo, helping 50+ nonprofits tell emotionally resonant stories through documentary productions. That taught me: the best technology means nothing if you can't tell a coherent story about what you do. I bring that lens to systems work. Every CRM, every workflow, every AI strategy‚Äîit's storytelling. I also host Visual Eyes Podcast, exploring storytelling, technology, and community impact. WHO I WORK WITH Leaders tired of tools that promise transformation but deliver headaches. Leaders ready to invest in foundational systems instead of chasing shiny objects. What I don't do: Sell software you don't need. Build AI that impresses investors but confuses teams. What I do: Ask hard questions. Design systems that reduce friction. Train teams to own tools‚Äînot be owned by them. MY CREDENTIALS ‚Ä¢ AI+ Chief AI Officer Certified ‚Ä¢ Board of Directors, HandsOn South Florida ‚Ä¢ Author: "Aligned Before AI" (Amazon, 2025) ‚Ä¢ Co-Founder, Visuals by Momo I don't sell what you don't need. I help you build what works. üìñ "Aligned Before AI" on Amazon üåê aligninnovate.com | visualsbymomo.com üìß chris@aligninnovate.com üéôÔ∏è Visual Eyes Podcast

summary: Welcome to my page! I am a make-it-happen strategic workforce development leader and Navy Veteran passionate about connecting mission-ready talent with high-impact opportunities in civilian industry. I currently serve as a workforce development connector across Illinois and Minnesota ‚Äî playing a pivotal role in revitalizing the maritime manufacturing sector by strengthening talent pipelines, expanding regional workforce capacity, and aligning employer needs with ready, capable professionals. At Return to Home Port¬Æ, a strategic management services firm, we are focused on bridging the military-to-civilian transition, I help connect employers with military-connected talent, navigate workforce programs and certifications, and design deliberate strategies that maximize organizational and individual outcomes. We use proprietary planning and analytical methodologies to foster meaningful relationships between employers and military-trained talent, unlocking value for businesses and transitioning service members alike. In my professional journey, I proudly served in the U.S. Navy ‚Äî an experience that instilled in me a deeply rooted commitment to leadership, disciplined execution, and mission focus. Building on that foundation, I earned my Master of Science in Human Resources Leadership from West Virginia University, equipping me with advanced expertise in talent strategy, organizational development, and people-centered solutions. I went on to found an HR Consultancy - Cappellos Holdings (DBA Cappellos HR Solutions) and boot strapped $500k of professional services in my first two years of business as a single owner and operator. I have delivered business management solutions for several Fortune 100, 500, and 1000 U.S. based companies and recently entered the world of government contracting. Across both public and private sectors, I specialize in workforce ecosystem development that accelerates growth, fosters inclusive talent pipelines, and strengthens the industrial base ‚Äî particularly in maritime manufacturing. I partner with educational institutions, employers, and workforce organizations to advance opportunities that help regions compete, innovate, and sustain long-term success. Let‚Äôs connect if you share an interest in talent strategy, veteran employment, maritime workforce development, or organizational transformation.

linkedin description: Return To Home Port¬Æ is a strategic planning consulting company. Our focus is assisting the civilian sector with military-connected programs, processes and people. EVERY company, business, learning institution, organization can benefit by fully understanding the military community. summary: I work with organizations and leaders who are trying to do something different, whether that‚Äôs rethinking their strategy, managing change, or building teams that actually function well. My background includes senior roles in higher education, leadership at a fast-growing education technology company, and over 15 years of consulting experience across sectors. Today, I lead transform.forward, a boutique consulting firm focused on strategy, organizational effectiveness, and leadership development. Our clients include public and private universities, government agencies, nonprofits, startups, corporations, and organizations in transition. The work often involves strategic planning, executive coaching, culture audits, org structure reviews, or facilitation of retreats and team development. Before launching transform.forward full time, I served as Chief of Staff and Assistant Vice President at a large private university, where I led division-wide strategy, oversaw $75M in projects and operating budgets, and built teams and systems to support change at scale. Earlier in my career, I helped scale an education tech company through multiple mergers and acquisitions, where I led consulting and research services, integrated marketing, customer advocacy, and product marketing. I‚Äôve taught graduate courses on strategic planning, assessment, and leadership theory, and my research includes topics like gamification, student engagement, and the evolving role of Chief of Staff in complex institutions. I stay connected to the field through writing, speaking, and working directly with leaders who are trying to get unstuck and move forward with clarity.

linkedin description: At transform.forward, we specialize in guiding leaders and organizations through the complexities of change‚Äîwhether that change is within their control or not. As a boutique advisory and coaching firm, we bring a unique focus on change management that empowers our clients to navigate uncertainty with clarity, adaptability, and confidence. Our mission is simple: to help you transform challenges into opportunities and unlock your full potential. What sets us apart is our approach. We don‚Äôt believe in one-size-fits-all solutions. Instead, we combine best practices and custom frameworks drawn from multiple industries to deliver insights that are both innovative and actionable. Our curated teams ensure that every project is led by experts with the right experience and backgrounds to meet your unique needs. This means you‚Äôll get a partnership tailored to your goals and grounded in proven strategies. Our clients range from higher education institutions and government agencies to non-profits and, increasingly, corporate leaders. Whether you're a university President reimagining your strategic plan,C-suite executive navigating organizational transformation, or a mid-level leader looking to grow, we‚Äôre here to help. No matter the sector, we bring an approachable, academic, and impactful style to our work‚Äîhelping you achieve agile confidence in your ability to lead change. Our services include strategic planning, executive coaching, team development, training, organizational reviews, and assessment and evaluation. Each offering is designed to help you align your vision with action, build resilient teams, and create meaningful, lasting impact. We don‚Äôt just deliver solutions; we build capacity, ensuring you and your organization are equipped to thrive long after our engagement ends. When you work with transform.forward, you‚Äôll feel confident in our expertise, inspired to take the next step, and curious to explore what‚Äôs possible. Let‚Äôs move forward‚Äîtogether.

linkedin description (3): About Us: Cell BioEngines is a US-based clinical-stage biotechnology company pioneering off-the-shelf, allogeneic cell therapies. Leveraging cord blood stem cells from highly compatible super-donors and powered by its proprietary STEM-Space platform, the company delivers scalable cell products with reduced risk of immune rejection. Cell BioEngines‚Äô competitive edge comes from a unique combination of a transgene-free manufacturing platform enabled by advanced biological/chemical programming, rigorous HLA-guided design, and a population-informed biobank that supports broad patient coverage. Cell BioEngines lead product is currently in a multi-center Phase 1b/2a trial for relapsed blood cancer patients including CAR-T cell therapy. The company emphasizes a robust, closed-loop manufacturing platform and has now entered into strategic collaboration with NVIDIA to model donor HLA-screening and population aligned biobank strategy . The pipeline also includes Type 1 dendritic cell therapy for solid tumors and other first-/best-in-class immunotherapy programs. For more information, visit www.cellbioengines.com and follow us on www.twitter.com/cell_bioengines

summary: ‚ÄúNever doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has.‚Äù ‚Äî Margaret Mead, American Anthropologist The impact of climate change is seen and felt all around us. Damages from severe weather events surpassed $8 billion for 2024 alone, compared to an average of $422 million/yr. between 1983 and 2008 (Insurance Bureau of Canada). The World Bank estimates that 40 percent of the global population lives in places of high vulnerability to climate change. "Business as usual" investing could put asset owners at risk of not meeting their fiduciary responsibilities, being misaligned with rapidly evolving regulations/guidelines or simply being out of touch with their stakeholders‚Äô sustainability convictions. I am the professional you can partner with and trust on your transition from the Institutional Investor you are to the Responsible Institutional Investor you aim to become. 1-Expertise and Experience: I am a qualified actuary (FCIA, FSA) and Chartered Investment Manager (CIM) with expertise in pension plan governance, funding, investing, ESG integration and management of climate-related risks and opportunities. I have 30 years of experience with global consulting firms, portfolio managers and plan sponsors. 2-Integrity and trustworthiness: As a member of the Canadian Institute of Actuaries (CIA) I adhere to strict Standards and Rules of Professional Conduct. I received the 2022 CIA President‚Äôs Award for my groundbreaking work as Chair of the Climate Change and Sustainability Committee serving the Institute‚Äôs 6,000 members. My clients value my honest communication, my creative thinking, and my rigorous analysis. I make my clients feel heard and respected. 3- Availability and affordability: You will have direct access to my in-depth knowledge of the Institutional Investment market to solve your Responsible Investment problems and challenges. I plan to manage my client load to maintain a high level of quality. My fees are affordable in comparison to large consulting firms. The following are some of the services I offer: ‚Ä¢ Education sessions for Board, management, or members ‚Ä¢ Diagnostic assessment with gap analysis vs. peers, regulations and best practice ‚Ä¢ Governance structure review ‚Ä¢ Workshop facilitation and action plan creation ‚Ä¢ Responsible Investment (RI) policy review/formulation and implementation ‚Ä¢ Climate Strategy development and implementation NEW STRATEGIC PARTNERSHIP in 2025 WITH SAI Inc. summary: You're surviving, but woefully inefficient because your team lacks purpose, alignment, and accountability. summary: Most companies fail at the same place: they can't bridge the gap between vision and execution. I help ambitious builders maintain momentum when complexity increases. My edge? 15 years building brands across industries most people think have nothing in common: healthcare, college athletics and the home services industry. Turns out, the frameworks that work aren't industry-specific. They're builder-specific. Here's what I've learned: The best brands don't just look good. They feel right. They create resonance, not just reach. The best systems don't just work once. They scale across contexts. What fixes patient experience also fixes customer acquisition. The best leaders don't choose between growth and sanity. They refuse to sacrifice soul for systems. summary: As the founder of HumanisVitalis, I help CEOs and senior leaders of growing organizations align people, strategy, and execution‚Äîtransforming HR from a reactive function into a strategic driver of performance and growth. I bring more than 25 years of global HR leadership experience to this work, including senior roles as VP of HR at Honeywell and Head of HR for AWS. Today, I partner with leadership teams to design scalable people strategies that strengthen alignment, accelerate decision-making, and enable sustainable growth‚Äîespecially during moments of change. Having lived and worked across the U.S., Mexico, Canada, Chile, and the U.K., I offer a globally informed and operationally grounded perspective. My experience spans technology, aerospace, retail, and manufacturing, and includes fractional CHRO leadership, organizational design, performance and talent systems, executive coaching, and HR operating model transformations. At the core of my work is a simple belief: meaningful contribution‚Äîhelping leaders and organizations operate with clarity, alignment, and purpose‚Äîis a powerful source of impact and fulfillment. That belief shapes how I advise, coach, and lead. If you‚Äôre a CEO or executive team looking to elevate your people strategy and strengthen organizational alignment, I‚Äôd welcome the opportunity to connect. linkedin description (2): Launched in 2006, Amazon Web Services (AWS) began exposing key infrastructure services to businesses in the form of web services -- now widely known as cloud computing. The ultimate benefit of cloud computing, and AWS, is the ability to leverage a new business model and turn capital infrastructure expenses into variable costs. Businesses no longer need to plan and procure servers and other IT resources weeks or months in advance. Using AWS, businesses can take advantage of Amazon's expertise and economies of scale to access resources when their business needs them, delivering results faster and at a lower cost. Today, Amazon Web Services provides a highly reliable, scalable, low-cost infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world. With data center locations in the U.S., Europe, Singapore, and Japan, customers across all industries are taking advantage of our low cost, elastic, open and flexible, secure platform.

summary: Dru is a high-energy presenter, leading advisor, and seasoned strategist with extensive experience in law, diversity & inclusion, advocacy, policy, and philanthropy. A recognized leader in the LGBTQ+ equality movement for more than 25 years, he now leads his own coaching and consulting practice, Dru Levasseur Consulting, LLC, and facilitates the Trans Legal Professionals Networking Program, a network of trans judges, law students, lawyers, and business professionals. He previously served as the Director of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion for the National LGBTQ+ Bar, creating and leading its DEI Consulting Practice, the first LGBTQ+ inclusion coaching and consulting program designed specifically to enable the implementation of best practice standards for LGBTQ+ equity in the legal profession. He directed Lambda Legal's Transgender Rights Project from 2009 to 2019, attending the first transgender policy meeting at the White House in 2011, and serving as counsel in landmark impact litigation cases and amicus briefs in federal courts, including the U.S. Supreme Court. He co-founded a national trans-led nonprofit, the Jim Collins Foundation, and currently serves alongside Gloria Steinem and other notable feminists as Vice-Chair for the ERA Coalition. A national and international media spokesperson, Dru has appeared in the New York Times, the Washington Post, Wall Street Journal, Associated Press, People Magazine, Self, Reuters, ABC, CBS, NBC, CNN, ABA Journal, Atlantic, Vice, Daily News, New York Post, USA Today, the Chicago Tribune, Fox News, NPR, Huffington Post, and was profiled in the Advocate and Vanguard Law Magazine. Dru contributed the chapter, ‚ÄúYour Authenticity is Your Power: Tales of a Trans Lawyer‚Äù in the 2023 book, Surviving Transphobia. Harvard Law School selected him as a Wasserstein Fellow for the 2021-2022 academic year. He is admitted in New York, Georgia, D.C., and Massachusetts.
job description: Dru Levasseur Consulting, LLC delivers high-impact Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) strategies for legal workplaces and offers professional coaching designed to support and empower leadership. Backed by more than 20 years of LGBTQ+ legal expertise with experience engaging over 40,000 corporate and legal professionals, Dru provides practical, results-driven solutions to meet your organization's unique needs.
job description (2): Serves as Vice-Chair for the ERA Coalition. Member of the board of directors for The ERA Coalition and The Fund for Women's Equality along with Gloria Steinem, Alyssa Milano, and other high-profile feminists. Served as Co-Chair of the CEO Search Committee for our current CEO, and serves on the Finance Committee, Governance Committee, and Legal Task Force. Led by the ERA Coalition, this diverse group includes national feminist organizations like the Feminist Majority and the National Organization for Women, advocates for women of color like the National Congress of Black Women, Inc., advocates for immigrants like the Dolores Huerta Foundation and the National Immigrant Women‚Äôs Advocacy Project, and LGBTQ+ groups like Gender Justice. We work with our partner organizations to provide a strong, multigenerational, inclusive forum for all voices. We are building the groundswell moving towards equality.
company (2): ERA Coalition and The Fund for Women‚Äôs Equality
linkedin description (2): The ERA Coalition represents nearly 100 member and lead organizations, and millions of women and men. We support and help lead the movement for passage of an equal rights amendment through public education and messaging campaigns. Our polling research shows that while 94% of Americans support constitutional equality for women and men, 80% mistakenly think it already exists. The ERA Coalition is working to close this information gap. The ERA Coalition works with its partner organizations to provide a strong forum for all voices advocating for passage of an equal rights amendment. The Coalition actively seeks to broaden the constituencies working for such a constitutional amendment by growing a strong national, inclusive and multi-generational movement to advance this mission. The ERA Coalition works closely with the lead sponsors of Equal Rights Amendment legislation to lobby Congress to take action and provides educational tools, advocacy training and resources to encourage constituency outreach and educate our supporters on the importance of meeting with their members of Congress. The ERA Coalition supports all legislative strategies that aim to increase constitutional protections against discrimination. In the 115th Congress, Congresswoman Maloney has introduced language that combines the 1972 language with wording similar to Alice Paul‚Äôs first draft, adding the word ‚Äúwomen‚Äù to the Constitution. Senator Menendez has introduced legislation that is identical to the 1972 language. Congresswoman Jackie Speier (CA) and Senator Ben Cardin (MD) have introduced companion bills to remove the deadline on the 1972 Equal Rights Amendment. For more information on why we need the ERA: http://www.eracoalition.org/files/whyweneedtheERA.pdf
linkedin specialities (2): Womens Rights, Equal Rights, Advocacy, Policy
linkedin company location (2): Washington, District of Columbia, United States
job title (3): Director of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
job description (3): Created and ran the LGBTQ+ Bar‚Äôs DEI Consulting Practice, the first LGBTQ+ inclusive coaching and consulting program designed specifically to enable the implementation of best practice standards for law firms, law schools, and workplaces. Provided customized keynote CLE presentations to large, global legal and corporate audiences on best practices in LGBTQ+ inclusion related to topics such as interrupting bias, recruiting and retaining underrepresented attorneys, and understanding intersectional LGBTQ+ experiences in the workplace. Reached more than 40,000 attendees from 2019 to 2024. education school linkedin description (2: Though the emergence of Hamdard University on the educational scene of Pakistan is in a fledgling stage yet the evolution it has witnessed thus far sets the trend that others are trying to replicate. The University does not want to rest on its laurels and therefore strives hard for further growth and maturity in order to be at par with renowned universities in the region. The Main Campus of Hamdard University at Madinat al-Hikmah is spread over a picturesque landscape and is located in the vicinity of Sindh Balochistan border 8 km from the commercial center of the metropolis, on the main highway leading to Bund Murad Khan. The location of the campus is of great historical and geographical significance. It lies on the main highway, which connects it to the Hub Chowki on the highway to Quetta, and is situated along the Hub River on the borders of Sindh and Baluchistan. The site, according to the renowned historians and archaeologists, is the place where Muhammad Bin Qasim, who made Sindh the gateway of Islam in the sub-continent, landed on his way to Daibal. The Campus is also closer to yet another celebrated site i.e. the shrine of Shah Noorani in Lasbela, Balochistan. Access to the university has been further strengthened for the people of the South West and North due to the completion of Northern By-pass which connects the Super Highway to Hamdard University on one hand and with Balochistan on the other.

summary: I‚Äôve spent my entire career inside HR. But the people I care about most aren‚Äôt sitting in corporate boardrooms. They‚Äôre running skilled trades and service businesses. They‚Äôre out in the field early, managing crews, juggling schedules, solving problems in real time ‚Äî and doing everything they can to keep the work moving and their people supported. And almost every one of them has said some version of the same thing to me: ‚ÄúI know HR matters‚Ä¶ I just don‚Äôt have the time. And honestly, I‚Äôm not even sure where to start.‚Äù That‚Äôs exactly why I founded On Demand HR Solutions. Small, growing trades businesses don‚Äôt need corporate HR theory or overbuilt policies that don‚Äôt fit how the work actually gets done. They need simple, practical HR support ‚Äî delivered in a way that works alongside the business, not on top of it. That‚Äôs where I come in. I work as an independent on-demand HR partner for skilled trades businesses, and I offer a few clear ways to get support, depending on what you need right now: HR SOS Session A focused, one-hour working session to tackle one specific HR issue ‚Äî a people problem, compliance question, hiring concern, or ‚Äúthis just came up and I need help‚Äù situation. HR Blueprint A short-term, hands-on engagement to put the HR foundations in place ‚Äî clear policies, better hiring and onboarding, and simple systems that bring structure and consistency to how you manage your crew. HR Advisory Ongoing HR support for owners who want a trusted partner in their corner ‚Äî someone they can call, message, or loop in when questions come up, decisions need to be made, or issues start to surface. No over-engineered solutions. No corporate speak. No judgment. Just honest, practical HR support designed for businesses where the work happens in the field. I believe HR should make running a business easier ‚Äî not harder. If you‚Äôre not sure which option makes sense, that‚Äôs okay. Most people aren‚Äôt. Send me a message here on LinkedIn and tell me what‚Äôs going on. I‚Äôll help you figure out the simplest next step. üì• Message me on LinkedIn ‚Äî I‚Äôm just one DM away.
job description: After more than 30 years leading HR in complex corporate environments, I started noticing a pattern. Small, growing skilled trades businesses were being asked to manage the same HR responsibilities: hiring, onboarding, safety, compliance, employee issues ‚Äî without the time, support, or internal HR teams that larger companies rely on. Most owners don't want to ‚Äúdo HR.‚Äù They just wanted the work to run smoothly, their crews supported, and their business protected. So I founded On Demand HR Solutions to meet them where they are. Today, I work as an on-demand HR partner for skilled trades and field-based businesses, helping owners put practical HR systems in place that actually work in real life. My focus is HR operations and people management that supports how trades businesses run day to day. That includes everything from hiring and onboarding crews, to setting clear expectations, handling employee issues, and staying compliant as the business grows. I step in where HR usually falls through the cracks and help bring structure, clarity, and consistency without overcomplicating things. job description (2): While my title at Integra LifeSciences changed over 16 years, the constant was transformation. Integra‚Äôs growth-by-acquisition strategy meant the business‚Äîand HR‚Äîwere always evolving. In my final role as Head of Global HR Service Delivery, I built and led what became the one-stop-shop for employee support across payroll, benefits, onboarding, leave of absence, employee relations and more. This work supported a dynamic, fast-scaling organization where clear, efficient HR processes were critical. But beyond the systems and processes, what I‚Äôm most proud of is how we made HR approachable again‚Äîturning a fragmented, confusing experience into one where employees felt supported and leaders had the tools they needed to lead confidently.
